intro: Teucrium jolyi, commonly known as Joly's germander, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or violet, arranged in whorled clusters along the stem. Teucrium jolyi is often found in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
